name: Too Much! Multiple Choice Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text:
What song do these lyrics, sung by JoJo, come from?  Remember, the word "Too" is in the title at least once.

"Come with me, stay the night
You say the words but boy it don't feel right
What do you expect me to say?"

I will give you a hint.  This song is featured on the PS2 game "Karaoke Revolution Presents: American Idol Encore 2".
questions.explanation:
Too Little Too Late.

	"Too Little Too Late" is on JoJo's second album "The High Road", which was released in 2006 in the US and 2007 in the UK and Ireland.  She first began her acting and singing career in 1998 when she appeared as a contestant on "America's Most Talented Kids".  She was only 7 years old.

questions.text:
Who sings these lyrics, from the song "Much Too Young (To Feel This Damn Old)"?

"The competition's getting younger
Tougher broncs, you know I can't recall
The worn out tape of Chris Ledoux, lonely women and bad booze
Seem to be the only friends I've left at all."
questions.explanation:
Garth Brooks.

	"Much Too Young (To Feel This Damn Old)" was Garth Brooks first ever single, on his self titled album "Garth Brooks".  It was released in 1989.  Since his debut album, he has released nine albums from 1989 to 2001 and five compilation albums from 1994 to 2007.

questions.text:
Which OneRepublic song do these lyrics come from?  Remember, "Too" must be in the title!

"Autumn wind turns again
The days are warm, start to fade
All that's here is still the same
Memories fall like rain."
questions.explanation:
Too Easy.

	"Too Easy" was not originally on any album, but it was released by iTunes in the "Stop and Stare" 3 Hit Pack in 2007.  OneRepublic formed in Colorado, and there two biggest hits from 2007 on their first album, "Dreaming Out Loud", were "Apologize" and "Stop and Stare".

questions.text:
What song by Rascal Flatts to these lyrics come from?  Remember, the word "Too" will appear in the title.

"Give me one more kiss
One more touch
Baby, I just can't get enough of you
This time, _ _ _ _."
questions.explanation:
Too Good is True.

	"Too Good is True" was released on the 2002 album, "Melt", by Rascal Flatts.  They released their first album, self-titled, in 2000, and in 2009 their eighth album was released.  "Melt" was their second studio album.

questions.text:
What song do these Tim McGraw lyrics come from?  Remember to use "Too" in the title!

"Without a minute to spare
You touched my heart
When I didn't have a prayer
In the darkest hour
With my world filled with gloom
Your sweet love saved me."

I'll give you a hint.  It's also the title of the album the song is on.
questions.explanation:
Not a Moment Too Soon.

	"Not a Moment Too Soon" was released in 1994 on Tim McGraw's album "Not a Moment Too Soon".  It was Tim McGraw's second studio album.  His first, in 1993, was self-titled, and from 1994-2009 he released ten albums.

questions.text:
Frank Sinatra sings these lyrics.  To which song do they belong?  Remember that "Too" is in the title.

"Be wise, be smart, behave, my heart
Don't upset your cart when she's so close
Be soft, be sweet, but be discreet
Don't go off your beat."
questions.explanation:
Too Close for Comfort.

	Frank Sinatra's 59 studio albums, two live albums, and eight compilation albums has produced 297 singles!  "Too Close for Comfort" was released in 1959 on Frank Sinatra's album "Come Dance With Me!", which won two Grammys.  Ol' Blue Eyes died in 1998, at the age of 82.

questions.text:
The song is "Too Darn Hot".  What musical do these lyrics come from?

"I'd like to coo to my baby tonight
And pitch the woo with my baby tonight."
options: You're A Good Man, Charlie Brown
questions.explanation:
Kiss Me, Kate.

	"Kiss Me, Kate" was released in 1948, and written by Cole Porter.  "Too Darn Hot" was sung by Paul and his specialty dancers.  Ella Fitzgerald sang the song in her 1956 album "Ella Fitzgerald Sings the Cole Porter Songbook".

questions.text:
These lyrics were song by the Specials.  To which song do they belong?

"Call me immature, call me a poser
I'd love to spread manure in your bed of roses
Don't want to be rich, don't want to be famous
But I'd really hate to have the same name as you."
questions.explanation:
Too Much Too Young.

	"Too Much Too Young" and "Too Hot" were both released on the Specials' first album, "Specials", released in 1979.  "Too Much Alcohol" is not a title of a Specials song, although "Alcohol" was released on their 1984 album, "In the Studio".  "Too Fearful" is also not a title of a Specials song, however: "Fearful" appears on their album "Guilty 'til Proved Innocent!", released in 1998.

questions.text:
Which Chuck Berry song do these lyrics come from?

"Runnin' to-and-fro- hard workin' at the mill
Never failed in the mail yet, come a rotten Bill!"
questions.explanation:
Too Much Monkey Business.

	"Too Much Monkey Business" is on Chuck Berry's 1957 album "After School Session".  "Too Pooped to Pop" is on his 1960 album "Rockin' at the Hops".  "You Too" is not the title of a Chuck Berry song, but, rather, it is "You Two", released on his 1964 album "St. Louis to Liverpool".  "It Hurts Me Too" was released on his 1967 album, "Chuck Berry in Memphis".

questions.text:
Who sings these lyrics, from the song "Too Much Time On My Hands"?

"I'm so tired of losin', I've got nothing to do
And all day to do it.
So, I go out cruisin', but I've no place to go
And all the night to get there.
Is it any wonder I'm not a criminal?
Is it any wonder I'm not in jail?"
questions.explanation:
Styx.

	"Too Much Time On My Hands" was released by Styx in their 1981 album "Paradise Theatre".  In the US, it reached 3x Platinum, and was the only album of theirs to reach the top spot on US charts.  Styx also sings "Come Sail Away" and "Mr. Roboto".
